Contributor: Kitchell, artist.; Liberty Loan Committee, publisher.; Beck Engraving Company.;
Note: Signed "Kitchell." Date of issue based on the date of the Third Liberty Loan campaign. Orientation:  Vertical. "Poster is contributed by The Beck Engraving Company."
Description: Under the illustration of the Kaiser speaking to "Gerard", the text urges the viewer to combat the Kaiser's "brutal" intent by buying Liberty Bonds, "till it hurts."
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
Local Rights Statement: This material is made available for private study, scholarship, and research use. For access to the original or a high resolution reproduction, contact: Temple University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center, scrc@temple.edu, 215-204-8257.
Subject: Liberty bonds -- United States.; World War,1914-1918 -- Propaganda.; World War, 1914-1918 -- Finance -- United States.; War posters, American.;

Title: "When this war is finished I will not stand any nonsense from the United States"
Source: From: "When this war is finished I will not stand any nonsense from the United States"
